drug.name: T487
drug.description: T487 is a small molecule chemokine receptor antagonist to correct or modify immune system responses. It binds selectively and potently to CXCR3. The formulation is administered orally and has anti-inflammatory effects in conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease and psoriasis.

article.citation: Heise CE, Pahuja A, Hudson SC, Mistry MS, Putnam AL, Gross MM, Gottlieb PA, Wade WS, Kiankarimi M, Schwarz D, Crowe P, Zlotnik A, Alleva DG: Pharmacological characterization of CXC chemokine receptor 3 ligands and a small molecule antagonist. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 2005 Jun;313(3):1263-71. Epub 2005 Mar 10.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in inflammatory disorders such as rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease and psoriasis.

drug.mechanism-of-action: T487 binds selectively and potently to CXCR3.
